TopicTitle: How do I switch between vessels while flying without viewing the map?

Articles.Content:
I've seen Youtubers do it, and it would be really useful if I knew how.

Edit: Thank you Slam\_Jones! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-04T21:46:28Z" title="04/04/2015 09:46  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 4, 2015</time> by Powdercat**
  
Answered my question.
The [ and ] keys will cycle you through all craft in the physics range (and debris, too!)

> 
> The [ and ] keys will cycle you through all craft in the physics range (and debris, too!)

What he said. And i believe physics range is 2.35Km or thereabout
Okay, but one more question, how do I turn the prefix on this thread to answered? This question may be off topic, but I usually don't go on any forums.

What slam\_jones says is correct, however it may vary, depending on what keyboard layout you have (qwertz/qwerty etc.) for me it's the Ã‚Â´ and ` key ^^.

 I suggest just checking the key mapping in the ksp options, as far as I remember there is such a thing.

> 
> Okay, but one more question, how do I turn the prefix on this thread to answered? This question may be off topic, but I usually don't go on any forums.

Click "Edit Post" at the bottom of your OP (original post). Click the "Go Advanced" button near the bottom right. Then, in the top left, there should be a drop-down box that allows you to change the prefix. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Edit your original post. Somewhere below the text section you will see a drop down menu called prefix, which will currently be set to unanswered.

> 
> What slam\_jones says is correct, however it may vary, depending on what keyboard layout you have (qwertz/qwerty etc.) for me it's the Ã‚Â´ and ` key ^^.
>  I suggest just checking the key mapping in the ksp options, as far as I remember there is such a thing.

I use / and = (i think), but to most people that corresponds to [ and ]

german keyboard: ÃƒÅ¸ and Ã‚Â´

took me some time to figure that out.
